ticket.title: 'Address' does not singularize properly
ticket.original-body:
Using Rails 2.3.5 or Rails 3.0.3, testing in irb:
@@@ 'Address'.singularize => "Addres" @@@
However, the following works:
@@@ 'Address'.pluralize.singularize => "Address" @@@
Note that this also means that 'Address'.classify fails, while 'Address'.pluralize.classify will work properly.
ticket.latest-body:
Using Rails 2.3.5 or Rails 3.0.3, testing in irb:
@@@ 'Address'.singularize => "Addres" @@@
However, the following works:
@@@ 'Address'.pluralize.singularize => "Address" @@@
Note that this also means that 'Address'.classify fails, while 'Address'.pluralize.classify will work properly.
ticket.original-body-html:
Using Rails 2.3.5 or Rails 3.0.3, testing in irb:

'Address'.singularize
=> "Addres"

However, the following works:

'Address'.pluralize.singularize
=> "Address"

Note that this also means that 'Address'.classify fails, while 'Address'.pluralize.classify will work properly.

version.body: See ticket 2399 - it looks like this is a well known issue for words ending in double s. A comment on the ticket explains how to address the problem.
version.body-html: See ticket 2399 - it looks like this is a well known issue for words ending in double s. A comment on the ticket explains how to address the problem.
version.title: 'Address' does not singularize properly

version.body:
From ticket 2399:
"Rails has a longstanding policy of not taking further inflector patches."
May I ask what is the reason behind this?
version.body-html:
From ticket 2399:

"Rails has a longstanding policy of not taking further inflector patches."

May I ask what is the reason behind this?
version.title: 'Address' does not singularize properly

version.body: Closing ticket as wontfix. Please fix inflections in your app's config/initializers/inflections.rb file
version.body-html: Closing ticket as wontfix. Please fix inflections in your app's config/initializers/inflections.rb file
version.title: 'Address' does not singularize properly

version.body:
@Andrés
The reason behind this is that Rails core does not aim to become a definitive source of english inflections and source of grammatical debates. Rails provides users to manage their own inflections as they see fit in their app's initializers/inflections.rb file.
version.body-html:
@Andrés

The reason behind this is that Rails core does not aim to become a definitive source of english inflections and source of grammatical debates. Rails provides users to manage their own inflections as they see fit in their app's initializers/inflections.rb file.
version.title: 'Address' does not singularize properly
